tit.e: Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region
Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region
Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region

sen.j: 近畿三十六不動尊（きんきさんじゅうろくふどうそん）は、大阪府・兵庫県・京都府・和歌山県・滋賀県・奈良県にある不動尊（不動明王）を祀る三十六ヶ所の霊場。
sen.e: The Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region is 36 sacred sites to enshrine Fudo-son (Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings)) in Osaka Prefecture, Hyogo Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture and Nara Prefecture.

The designation "Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region" denotes 36 sacred sites that enshrine Fudo-son (Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings)) in the prefectures of Osaka, Hyogo, Kyoto, Wakayama, Shiga and Nara.

The designation "Thirty-Six Fudo Temples in the Kinki Region" denotes 36 sacred sites that enshrine Fudo-son (Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings)) in the prefectures of Osaka, Hyogo, Kyoto, Wakayama, Shiga and Nara.

sen.j: 霊場の選定にあたっては、宗派にとらわれす、一般の人々からの立場からの意見を取り入れて、1979年（昭和54年）に古寺顕彰会が中心となり選定した。
sen.e: The sacred sites were selected mainly by Koji Kenshokai in 1979 by incorporating opinions from the general public regardless of religious schools.
sen.cmt: 古寺顕彰会は、Koji Kenshokaiと訳しました。
sen.e: The sacred sites were selected in 1979, mainly by Koji Kenshokai, who incorporated opinions from the general public regardless of any particular school of religion.
The sacred sites were selected in 1979, mainly by Koji Kenshokai, who incorporated opinions from the general public regardless of any particular school of religion.

sen.j: 三十六の数の由来は、不動明王の眷属が三十六童子であることによる。
sen.e: The number 36 was derived by the fact that there were 36 Doji (children) who were Fudo Myoo's kenzoku (messengers).
The number 36 was derived from the fact that there were 36 doji (children) who were Fudo Myoo's kenzoku (messengers).
The number 36 was derived from the fact that there were 36 doji (children) who were Fudo Myoo's kenzoku (messengers).

sen.j: また、人間の煩悩三十六支を表し、三十六ヶ寺を巡拝することによって煩悩を消除する意味も含まれている。
sen.e: It also represents 36 Bonno (earthly human desires), and implies that the earthly desires can be removed by making a round of pilgrimages to the 36 temples.
It also represents 36 bonno (earthly human desires), and implies that earthly desires can be erased by making a round of pilgrimages to the 36 temples.
It also represents 36 bonno (earthly human desires), and implies that earthly desires can be erased by making a round of pilgrimages to the 36 temples.
